content:
I am trying to understand the intent of how slices are displayed in the implementation guide using FSH/SUSHI. I have created an extension for Group, and named the extension on the Profile(shown in screenshot is this -> * extension contains GroupRecordType named recordType 1..1)

I am confused why "recordType" does not show as the slice name instead of the Extension name. If I click into the detailed description the slice name shows are recordType. This seems to conflict with naming the extension in the Profile. Basically, I am trying to understand why the named part of defining the extension does not show in the differential.

Extension defined for the profile - Highlighted portion is what I expected to see in the IG differential for Group
image.png

Extension definition - highlighted portion is what shows in the IG differential for Group
image.png

IG Differential display
image.png

Detailed Description display
image.png

Hi @Andy Devitt. I'm guessing that the folks behind the IG Publisher just decided that it would be better for the differential view to show the extension ID rather than the extension slice name where it was used. @Grahame Grieve or @Lloyd McKenzie, do you have any insight into why you've chosen to list extension slices by their id rather than the provided slice name?
Thanks Chris, if I use the ID as what I want to display it works perfect! :grinning: I think we will move towards that setup for our FSH files and implementation guides at this time.
Andy Devitt has marked this topic as resolved.
